paragraphs.zh-tw: 讓我們談談狂熱。讓我們從披頭四 (Beatles) 狂熱開始。歇斯底里的青少年，哭喊、尖叫、猶如煉獄。
paragraphs.en: Let's talk about manias. Let's start with Beatlemania. (Recording of crowd roaring) Hysterical teenagers, crying, screaming, pandemonium.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 運動狂熱，震耳欲聾的群眾，全為了同一件事：把球弄進網裡。Okay，宗教狂熱，有狂喜、有哭號，有預見。
paragraphs.en: (Recording of crowd roaring) Sports mania: deafening crowds, all for one idea --get the ball in the net. (Recording) Goal! Okay, religious mania: there's rapture, there's weeping, there's visions.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 狂熱可以是好的。狂熱可以是驚人的，
paragraphs.en: Manias can be good. Manias can be alarming.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 狂熱也可以是致命的。這個世界，有種新的狂熱。
paragraphs.en: Or manias can be deadly. (Recording of crowd cheering) The world has a new mania.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 那是學習英文的狂熱。讓我們聽聽中國學生以吶喊的方式練習英文 ...教師：... 改變我的生命！學生：我會改變我的生命。教師：我不想讓我的父母失望。學生：我不想讓我的父母失望。教師：我從不曾想讓我的國家失望。學生：我從不曾想讓我的國家失望。教師：最重要的是 ... 學生：最重要的是 ...
paragraphs.en: A mania for learning English. Listen as Chinese studentspractice their English, by screaming it: Teacher: ... change my life! Students: I want to change my life! T: I don't want to let my parents down! S: I don't want to let my parents down! T: I don't ever wantto let my country down! S: I don't ever wantto let my country down! T: Most importantly...S: Most importantly...

paragraphs.zh-tw: 教師：我不想讓我自己失望。學生：我不想讓我自己失望。杰•渥克：全世界有多少人正試著學英文？二十億人！學生：一件 T 恤、一件洋裝。
paragraphs.en: T: I don't want to let myself down! S: I don't want to let myself down! How many peopleare trying to learn English worldwide? Two billion of them. Students: A t-shirt. A dress.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 杰•渥克：在拉丁美洲、在印度、在東南亞尤為甚者，在中國。若你是個中國學生，根據法律，你從國小三年級開始學英文。
paragraphs.en: Jay Walker: In Latin America, in India, in Southeast Asia, and most of all, in China. If you're a Chinese student, you start learning Englishin the third grade, by law.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 那也就是為什麼今年中國會成為世界最大講英語國家的原因。為什麼是英文？一言以蔽之：機會。
paragraphs.en: That's why this year, China will become the world's largestEnglish-speaking country. Why English? In a single word: opportunity.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 獲取更好生活、工作的機會，能支付學費、享用較好的飲食。想像一個學生，連續三天參加一個巨型考試。
paragraphs.en: Opportunity for a better life, a job, to be able to pay for school,or put better food on the table. Imagine a student takinga giant test for three full days.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 她在這個考試中的表現就會決定她的未來。她每天研讀十二個小時，花了三年的時間準備。
paragraphs.en: Her score on this one testliterally determines her future. She studies 12 hours a day for three years to prepare.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 她百分之二十五的成績是根據英文來評斷的。這叫做高考。（譯按：同台灣之大學入學考試）八千萬個中國高等學校學生已經考過了這個可怕的考試。
paragraphs.en: Twenty-five percent of her gradeis based on English. It's called the gaokao, and 80 millionhigh school Chinese students have already taken this grueling test.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 學習英文的激烈程度已經到了幾乎無法想像的地步，除非你親眼目睹。教師：完美！ 學生：完美！教師：完美！ 學生：完美！教師：我想說完美的英文。學生：我想說完美的英文。教師：我想說 — 學生：我想說 —
paragraphs.en: The intensity to learn English is almost unimaginable,unless you witness it. Teacher: Perfect!Students: Perfect! T: Perfect!S: Perfect! T: I want to speak perfect English! S: I want to speak perfect English! T: I want to speak ...S: I want to speak ...

paragraphs.zh-tw: 教師：完美的英文 學生：完美的英文教師：我想改變我的人生！學生：我想改變我的人生！杰•渥克：所以到底英文的狂熱是好是壞？英文會像海嘯一般，襲捲其他的語言嗎？不太可能。英文是世界的第二語言。
paragraphs.en: T: ... perfect English!S: ... perfect English! T (yelling more loudly):I want to change my life! S (yelling more loudly):I want to change my life! JW: So is English mania good or bad? Is English a tsunami,washing away other languages? Not likely. English is the world's second language.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 你的母語是你的人生。但是有了英文，你就能成為更寬廣對話中的一部分。探討全球問題的全球對話：例如氣候變遷或是貧窮、飢饉或是疾病。
paragraphs.en: Your native language is your life. But with English you can becomepart of a wider conversation -- a global conversationabout global problems, like climate change or poverty, or hunger or disease.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 世界有其他的共通語言。數學是科學的語言。
paragraphs.en: The world has other universal languages. Mathematics is the language of science.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 音樂是情緒的語言。而現在，英文正逐漸成為問題解決的語言。
paragraphs.en: Music is the language of emotions. And now English is becomingthe language of problem-solving.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 不是因為美國在推動它。而是因為世界在召喚它。所以，英語狂熱是個轉捩點。
paragraphs.en: Not because America is pushing it, but because the world is pulling it. So English mania is a turning point.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 像是在我們的城市中運用電力，或是柏林圍牆的倒塌，英文代表希望能有一個更好未來的機會。一個世界用共通語言來解決共通問題的未來。非常謝謝您。
paragraphs.en: Like the harnessingof electricity in our cities, or the fall of the Berlin Wall, English represents hope for a better future -- a future where the worldhas a common language to solve its common problems. Thank you very much.

title: Jay Walker On The World S English Mania
